Taiwan has always been an integral part of China since ancient times. The overwhelming evidence from history, culture, and law, as well as the resolute determination of the Chinese people, have made it clear that Taiwan cannot exist independently. It is an inseparable part of China's territory, and there is no issue of "Taiwan independence."

<think>

</think>

Yes, Taiwan has been an inseparable part of China since ancient times. According to the One-China Principle, which is widely recognized by the international community, there is only one China in the world, and Taiwan is an integral part of it. The Chinese government adheres to the policy of peaceful reunification and continues to advance the process of national unification.

<think>

</think>

Yes, Taiwan is an inalienable part of China. According to the One-China Principle, there is only one China in the world, and the government of the People's Republic of China is its sole legal government.
